predicate.note: Frames file for 'carry' based on Chris' old frames file. Some modification required.

roleset.name: bring with, have

example.name: basic transitive
example.text: Citibank carries $150 million in earthquake insurance.

example.name: with instrument object
example.text: T-shirts carried the school logo on the front.

example.name: with with
example.text: The transportation bill carries with it a permanent smoking ban.

roleset.note: The Instrument tag should be reserved for overt object instruments (see above example), for reasons of consistency.

example.name: made up
example.text: Mary will carry on with John's work.

example.name: converted from 'continue'
example.text: Investors carry on *trace* pouring cash into money funds.

example.name: made up, inverted
example.text: Despite his death, John's work will carry on.

example.name: transitive
example.text: Management carried out the plan over the objections of the workers.
example.arg: over the objections of the workers

roleset.name: carry over: continue

example.name: agentive
example.text: John carried yesterday's discussion over into today's meeting.

example.name: ergative
example.text: The discussion carried over from the meeting into lunch.

roleset.note: Yes, I know "from whence" and "to whither" are tautologies. But do you know why?

example.name: can he do it?
example.text: But can Mr. Hahn carry it off?
